thread.title: Louisville fan arrested after running onto court
thread.title_full: Louisville fan arrested after running onto court

author: Mike Rutherford
title: Louisville fan arrested after running onto court
text:
A scary moment took place in the middle of Louisville’s win over Miami on Saturday. 
A Louisville fan was arrested after he stormed the court during the Cardinals’ 71-66 win over Miami Saturday afternoon at the KFC Yum! Center.
Randall Bolton, 31, was charged with fourth-degree assault, disorderly conduct, terroristic threatening and trespassing, said Louisville Metro Police spokeswoman Alicia Smiley. 
Video of fan being removed from court pic.twitter.com/Rnb6YyeUzB 
— Lou Sports Network (@CardsRadio) February 11, 2017 Bolton ran onto the court from the stands during a timeout, made contact with one of the University of Louisville dancers, and then attempted to make his way into the Miami team huddle. 
"There was a little bit of a commotion in our huddle," Miami coach Jim Larranaga said after the game. "I glanced up, and there was someone there in our huddle, I believe in red. We don't normally wear red."
Fans near the court reported that Bolton appeared to be shouting something as he was restrained by police, but nobody seemed to be able to make out what it was. No one was harmed during the incident. 
Louisville erased a seven-point halftime deficit in the game to top Miami and claim its 20th victory of the season.
